alert.note: Alert for Arenac; Crawford; Gladwin; Montmorency; Ogemaw; Oscoda; Roscommon (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 11:53PM EDT by NWS Gaylord
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Arenac, Gladwin, southeastern Crawford, Ogemaw, eastern Roscommon, southeastern Montmorency and Oscoda Counties through 100 AM EDT... At 1153 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles east of Grayling to Lake St. Helen to near Coleman. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... St. Helen and Lake St. Helen around 1200 AM EDT. Gladwin, Clear Lake and Red Oak around 1210 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Winegars, Garland, Wooden Shoe Village, Rose Township, Luzerne, Mack Lake, Mio, Loud Township, Alger, Sterling and Lockwood Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Arenac; Crawford; Gladwin; Montmorency; Ogemaw; Oscoda; Roscommon
